term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - canonical rate constant
term.title: canonical rate constant

item.text: The rate constant for a system in which the reactants are in thermal equilibrium at a given temperature. In statistical mechanics the expression 'canonical ensemble' is used to refer to a closed system in thermal equilibrium, the species being present in a statistical distribution. By contrast, a microcanonical ensemble is composed of systems all having the same energy: a canonical ensemble therefore consists of a statistical distribution of microcanonical ensembles. The canonical or thermal rate constant can be obtained from the microcanonical rate constant by summing over the energy, taking into account the statistical distribution.
